tidbits.title: Extreme Weather
tidbits.description: Antarctica is the coldest, windiest, and driest continent on Earth. Its temperatures can plummet below -80°C (-112°F), and winds often exceed hurricane force.

tidbits.title: Unique Ecosystem
tidbits.description: Despite its harsh conditions, Antarctica supports diverse wildlife, including penguins, seals, whales, and various seabirds, adapted to survive in this extreme environment.

tidbits.title: Scientific Research Hub
tidbits.description: Antarctica serves as a global center for scientific research, offering insights into climate change, astronomy, geology, and studies on adaptation to extreme conditions.
